Question: This person was named the American Humanist Association's 2012 Humanist of the Year for her activism in feminism and LGBT rights.
Hints: This person had had an abortion herself in London at the age of 22.
In the late 1950s, this person spent two years in India as a Chester Bowles Asian Fellow.
Greer leveled her most searing critique on this person for her capitulation on abortion rights.
